boardgame.name: Geschichten aus 1001 Nacht
Le Jeu des Mille et Une Nuits
Tales of the Arabian Nights
一千零一夜
boardgame.description: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; This entry is for the West End Games version and other printings. For the 2009 Z-Man Games version, go to Tales of the Arabian Nights_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Tales of the Arabian Nights is actually several games in one._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the standard game, the players are characters living in the 1001 Nights universe, wandering about the map and having adventures. These adventures are designed in a sort of paragraph system, with the player to your left reading what happens to you and exposing the choices you have - choices that then lead to other paragraphs or outcomes. The characters evolve during their adventures, acquiring skills of various degrees of advancement to open up new options and various _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;statuses_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; (such as married, despondent, cursed, etc) which also affect play. The object is to become rich and come back to Baghdad._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Other variants of the standard game include the Quest game, which forces you to roam the map looking for quests to fulfill. There's also a Merchant game, where your adventures give you arrow tokens which are used on a little separate board to simulate the progress of your caravans._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The German edition, Geschichten aus 1001 Nacht, was published in 2000 and contained a revised Book of Tales along with some extra adventures._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-implemented by:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Tales of the Arabian Nights_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve Been Diced! episode 3: Games that stood the test of time
The Vintage Gamer #28: Tales of the Arabian Nights

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: DESCRIPTION: Unpunched, unplayed, and complete. I removed the shrinkwrap, checked the contents, then shelved it as a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;backup_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; copy. My play copy is still holding up well, so I can stand to part with this one if you _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;make me an offer I can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;#039;t refuse_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;...

DESCRIPTION: Box is in used condition, with some scuffed edges. The board, counters, cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Book of Tales_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, etc. are, however, in excellent condition, and appear unused. (Please see photographs 1 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; 2). IMPORTANT: However, there is a (tea? coffee?) stain on the front of the rule book. (Please see the third photograph, which clearly shows this, as I want to ensure any potential buyer knows exactly what they are purchasing). The stain does not affect the legibility of any of the rules, and is only present on the rules booklet, the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Book of Tales_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; is unspoiled and in excellent condition. ABOUT ME: Please see my 100% positive feedback on eBay: username _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;ptdavies_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. PAYMENT AND SHIPPING. Although resident in the UK, I will ship worldwide, and will notify the purchaser of shipping costs asap. Please pay with PayPal (no surcharges).

The price is $100. Don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t send me an offer for anything less as I will reject it. The pieces and manuals are generally in very good shape. The Book of Tales has a slight yellowing. The book is scoffed. One of the map board sections has come lose from the other three. Shipping will be USPS priority with delivery confirmation. The weight shipped will be 2.5 pounds. Shipping to Maine would be $8.30
This game was a preorder.

West End Games English Edition in excellent condition. Pieces are all included and in excellent condition, including the board. When I received the game from an ebay auction, the game had never been played and the pieces were unpunched. I separated and bagged the components and played the game once. The outside box has a crease on it along the top, but it doesn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t affect the contents of the box. Both owners were non-smoking households. Buyer to pay shipping cost from 12207 zip code in New York State.
German edition, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;Geschichten aus 1001 Nacht_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;. Still new in foil.

Game is rated good only because the box shows some wear (see photo). Inside all the components are present and I doubt it was ever played. Quite a few counters still unseperated. Great condition for a hard to find game like this one. In addition the former owner included cards in German language and German rules. Shipping at actual cost dependend on destination, total weight and method of shipment chosen. Usually shipping a single (regular sized) boardgame (surface) costs 12.90€ worldwide and 8.60€ within Europe. Smaller games ship cheaper. Of course multiple games can be combined.

Quite scarce West End Games 1985 Version. Totally unpunched, Cards un-separated, box has some shelf ware but displays awesome (check pics). Feel free to email me any questions or game requests. Shipping includes Delivery Confirmation. I ship worldwide. Thanks for looking :)
Geschichten aus 1001 Nacht - Edition Erlkoenig. Cards still in shrink. Shipping is 10.00$ within U.S., insurance 1.30$ opotional.

This is the edition Erlkonig version from Germany, completely updated with English paste-ups and a printed English book of tales. It is _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;like new_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; instead of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;new_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; because I have obviously made these modifications. I spent many, many hours laboriously applying English paste-ups to all the little chits and cards and board. It was an exercise in perfectionism, and very well done. The game comes with the German book of tales, and the English book of tales I will include in a separate 3-ring binder. We only began one game, and it lasted for about 15 minutes, so the game is pretty pristine. Please let me know if you have questions.

West End Games English edition. Box is old, and has had some split sides repaired with clear tape. Other than that, it is solid, and good looking. Components are in very good shape, and complete. I was a boardgame collector in the Eighties, but have not played in the last fifteen years. I never bought used items, I only bought them new in the shop. I have NEVER played TALES OF THE ARABIAN NIGHTS by West End Games. Counters are unpunched, Cards are punched. The board is MINT as are the rulebook and the rest. This is a *serious* paste-up job of the original German version of the game (Geschichten aus 1001 Nacht). But it is much more than a paste-up. The Book Of Tales that originally came with the game (which would have been in German) is missing, but it has been replaced with a binder that contains the print-out of the *expanded* English book of Tales. This was done by the original (English-speaking) designer. The discussion of The Book of Tales and the paste-up in general can be read here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/84657/totan-availability... *Everything* - the board, the cards, the counters - has been pasted up with (well-done and good-looking) stickers; with the exception of a few of the Condition Cards, but the ones that don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t have stickers are translated on an enclosed sheet. The original rules (which would have been in German) are missing, but I have a print-out of the West End Games English version of the rules included.
